{{short description|Australian pop duo}} {{For|the album|The Veronicas (album)}} {{Use Australian English|date=May 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=January 2020}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = The Veronicas | image = The Veronicas 2012.jpg | caption = The Veronicas in 2012 | background = group_or_band | origin = [[Albany Creek, Queensland]], Australia | genre = {{flatlist| * [[Pop music|Pop]] * [[electropop]] * [[progressive pop]] * [[pop rock]] * [[pop punk]] {{cite web|url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/the-veronicas-mn0000978359|title=The Veronicas: Biography, albums and streaming radio|website=[[AllMusic]]|access-date=11 July 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160716023602/http://www.allmusic.com/artist/the-veronicas-mn0000978359|archive-date=16 July 2016|url-status=live}} }} | years_active = 2004–present | label = {{flatlist| * [[Warner Bros. Records|Warner Bros.]] * [[Sony Music Entertainment|Sony Music]]}} | website = {{URL|http://www.theveronicas.com/}} | current_members = [[Lisa Origliasso]]
[[Jessica Origliasso]] }} '''The Veronicas''' is an Australian [[pop music|pop]] duo from [[Brisbane]]. The group was formed in 2004 by identical twin sisters [[Lisa Origliasso|Lisa]] and [[Jessica Origliasso]]. In 2005, the Veronicas released their debut studio album, titled ''[[The Secret Life Of... (album)|The Secret Life of...]]'', which peaked at number two on the [[ARIA Charts|Australian Album Chart]] and was certified [[ARIA certification|4× platinum]] by [[Australian Recording Industry Association]] (ARIA) for selling over 280,000 copies. The album spawned five singles, led by "[[4ever (The Veronicas song)|4ever]]", three of which were top ten singles in Australia. In 2007, the duo released their second studio album, ''[[Hook Me Up]]'', which also peaked at number two in Australia and was certified 2× platinum for selling over 140,000 copies. The album garnered four Australian top ten singles. The album's title track, "[[Hook Me Up (song)|Hook Me Up]]", was the Veronicas' first number one single in Australia,[http://www.mtviggy.com/video/music-video-the-veronicas-hook-me-up The Veronicas- "Hook Me Up"] MTV Iggy while "[[Untouched (song)|Untouched]]" was an international top-ten hit. Following a lengthy hiatus (broken only by the July 2012 release of the Australian top-40 single "[[Lolita (The Veronicas song)|Lolita]]" and various gigs for their fans), in September 2014, the Veronicas released "[[You Ruin Me]]", the first single from their [[The Veronicas (album)|self-titled third studio album]]. The song debuted at number one on the ARIA chart, becoming the women's second chart-topping single and their first to debut in the top spot. It also charted in United States and United Kingdom. The album was released both physically and digitally on 21 November 2014. {{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-30051670 |title=The Veronicas' triumphant return from pop purgatory – BBC News |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date= 17 November 2014|access-date=3 April 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150218224858/http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-30051670 |archive-date=18 February 2015 |url-status=live |work=BBC News |last1=Savage |first1=Mark }} In 2016, they hosted the [[ARIA Music Awards]]. {{cite news|date=November 2016|url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/lifestyle/news/article.cfm?c_id=6&objectid=11754079|title=The Veronicas' topless glitch at the 2016 ARIA Awards|publisher=[[The New Zealand Herald]]|work=News Corp Australia Network|author=Shoba Rao|access-date=24 November 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161124193813/http://www.nzherald.co.nz/lifestyle/news/article.cfm?c_id=6&objectid=11754079|archive-date=24 November 2016|url-status=live}} They spent most of the period between 2016 and 2021 releasing gold and platinum singles in Australia, leading to the release of both their fourth and fifth albums, ''[[Godzilla (The Veronicas album)|Godzilla]]'' and ''[[Human (The Veronicas album)|Human]]'', in May and June 2021, respectively.{{Cite web|url=https://au.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/the-veronicas-announce-albums-godzilla-human-24541/|title=The Veronicas Announce Two New Albums, 'GODZILLA' and 'HUMAN'|date=25 March 2021}} In October 2020, the sisters were announced as competing celebrity contestants on the fifth season of ''[[The Celebrity Apprentice Australia]]'' in 2021.{{cite web|url=https://tvtonight.com.au/2020/10/the-veronicas-take-on-celebrity-apprentice.html|title=Celebrities revealed for Celebrity Apprentice|publisher=TV Tonight|date=12 October 2020|access-date=12 October 2020|first=David|last=Knox}} ==Background== In 2001, the identical twins Lisa and Jessica Origlasso made their first demonstration recordings with Brisbane producer [[Stuart Stuart]] at Analog Heart Records. Stuart produced an EP in a more electronic style and, a year later, a second batch of songs in the pop rock style that the group initially became known for. In 2004, the sisters, who were then performing as "The Twins" (and who were being managed by their father Joseph Origliasso at that time), were introduced by Gabrielle McKinley to Robin Donald Smith. Smith was a former operatic tenor who had performed overseas with the Sadlers Well Opera and at the Sydney Opera House with the Australian Opera, who owned the recording and music publishing company Multiplay Music Australia. After meeting Joseph and auditioning Lisa and Jessica, Multiplay Music Australia offered to sign The Twins to their first recording and music publishing agreements. After signing the Twins, the following year Smith and Bell, funded by Multiplay Music Australia, took the Twins on several world-wide songwriting trips to Britain, Sweden, Canada and the US in order for them to collaborate with top songwriters in each country to further develop their songwriting skills. These included Clif Magness (who has written with [[Avril Lavigne]]), [[Billy Steinberg]] ([[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]], [[Cyndi Lauper]]), [[Max Martin]] ([[Britney Spears]], [[Katy Perry]], [[Pink (singer)|P!nk]]), Eric Nova, Dead Mono and Vince DeGiorgio, where they created a catalogue of over 50 songs.{{cite web|title=Official Website: About |url=http://www.theveronicas.com/indexhtml.html#aboutanchor |access-date=30 June 2007 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070612171103/http://www.theveronicas.com/indexhtml.html#aboutanchor |archive-date=12 June 2007 |url-status=dead }}{{Failed verification|date=February 2014}} Multiplay also secured introductions and auditions for them with numerous recording companies, including Sony, EMI, Universal, BMG and Warner Music. On their return to Australia, Smith and Bell met with the executives at Engine Room (a subsidiary of PBL (Packer) Group). Throughout the year Multiplay then negotiated with Engine Room to contract the Twins to secure a recording contracts with Warner Music. Meetings were then arranged with [[Warner Bros. Records]] in the US. [[Seymour Stein]] and senior executives recognised that Smith and Bell had discovered and developed a musical talent, signing them quickly to a recording contract with Warner Bros. Records/Sire America, for a reported sum of two million dollars.{{cite news|title=The year of the Veronicas|url=http://www.smh.com.au/articles/2006/09/17/1158431579902.html|access-date=22 October 2013|newspaper=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]]|date=18 September 2006}}{{Failed verification|date=February 2014}} ===Band name=== Regarding how they chose their name, Jess Origliasso stated: "The name is something we thought about for a short time and we wanted it to be a girl's name, but we didn't want it to be 'the Jesses.' We were very conscious of not wanting to make it a twin thing, because we don't think that's really cool." "We didn't want it to be called 'the Lisas,' either," singer Lisa Origliasso added. "So one day we saw the movie ''[[Heathers]]'', and there's a line where [[Christian Slater]] asks, 'Are you a Heather?' and [[Winona Ryder|Winona Ryder's]] character [Veronica] answers, 'No, I'm a Veronica,' and so we went with that, because she was this kind of cool, unique chick with an attitude."{{cite news|last1=Montgomery |first1=James |last2=Paco |first2=Matt |title=The Veronicas |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/yhif/the_veronicas/ |access-date=22 October 2013 |newspaper=[[MTV.com]] |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090224030929/http://www.mtv.com/news/yhif/the_veronicas/ |archive-date=24 February 2009 }} ====Relationship with Archie Comics==== [[File:Veronica 167.png|thumb|upright|The cover of ''Veronica#167'' by Archie Comics, featuring the Veronicas, Veronica Lodge and Archie Andrews]] When it learned about the group, [[Archie Comics]] launched [[legal action]] against the group for [[trademark infringement]] in relation to popular character [[Veronica Lodge]] – who is also known for being a female character with an attitude – in an attempt to stop them from using the name.{{cite news|last=Drever|first=Andrew|title=Overarching action|url=http://www.theage.com.au/news/music/the-word/2005/08/24/1124562925198.html|access-date=22 October 2013|newspaper=[[The Age]]|date=26 August 2005}} {{cite news|title=Archie Comic Sues Warner Over Veronicas|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2005/aug/16/business/fi-rup16.1|access-date=22 October 2013|newspaper=[[Los Angeles Times]]|date=16 August 2005|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131024105223/http://articles.latimes.com/2005/aug/16/business/fi-rup16.1|archive-date=24 October 2013|url-status=live}} Archie Comics had asked [[Warner Music Group]] to hand over all publicity rights and to pay [[United States dollar|US$]]200 million in damages. {{cite news|last=Grossman|first=Jeff|title=This Archie Comic Includes a Lawsuit|url=https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=980CE7D91731F937A3575AC0A9639C8B63|access-date=22 October 2013|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|date=4 September 2005|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131022055842/http://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=980CE7D91731F937A3575AC0A9639C8B63|archive-date=22 October 2013|url-status=live}} Of this amount, $20 million was for damages and $180 million as a penalty against Warner. In a statement with ''[[The New York Times]]'' Michael I. Silberkleit, chairman of [[Archie Comics Publications, Inc.]] stated,
''The importance is the image of Archie, which everybody knows is good, clean, wholesome stuff ... Preventing unauthorized use of the name will protect both the characters and customers who have paid for licensing rights[...]"
A settlement was reached that included a [[cross-promotion]] deal, including an appearance in an issue of Veronica's series.{{cite news|last=Donovan|first=Patrick|title=Smart, savvy, very classy|url=http://www.theage.com.au/news/music/sticky-carpet/2005/12/08/1133829695994.html|access-date=22 October 2013|newspaper=The Age|date=9 December 2005}} The issue (''Veronica #167'', released on 1 March 2006) featured the Veronicas in the feature story, ''What's In A Name?'', in which they meet Lodge, perform in Riverdale and spend a day there, as well as a card with a code allowing a free download of their single "4ever" in [[MP3]] form.{{cite news|title=This December, mega-hot singing duo The Veronicas meet their namesake, Veronica Lodge!|url=http://www.archiecomics.com/theveronicas/pr.html|access-date=22 October 2013|newspaper=Archive Comics|date=28 August 2007|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080119205552/http://www.archiecomics.com/theveronicas/pr.html |archive-date=19 January 2008 }} A few months later, ''Archie and Friends'' (No. 100) featured the Archies meeting the Veronicas. Archie Comics No. 100. [http://www.comicbookresources.com/?page=article&id=6057 The Veronicas Join With Archie] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304061128/http://www.comicbookresources.com/?page=article&id=6057 |date=4 March 2016 }} comicbookresources.com. Retrieved 26 December 2009. The next issue of ''Archie and Friends'' (No. 101) also featured the Veronicas, with Archie as their biggest fan. Archie Comics No. 101. [http://www.comicbookbin.com/Archie_And_Friends_101.html Archie And Friends No. 101] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304054025/http://www.comicbookbin.com/Archie_And_Friends_101.html |date=4 March 2016 }} comicbookbin.com. Retrieved 26 December 2009. ==Music career== ===2005–2006: ''The Secret Life of...''=== The Veronicas performed at the [[2005 NRL Grand Final]]{{cite news|last=Halloran|first=Jessica|title=Stereotype fun: toys for boys and short skirts for girls|url=http://www.smh.com.au/news/league/stereotype-fun-toys-for-boys-and-short-skirts-for-girls/2005/10/02/1128191607835.html|access-date=30 August 2011|newspaper=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]]|date=3 October 2005}} days before their debut album, titled ''[[The Secret Life Of... (album)|The Secret Life of...]]'', was released in Australia on 17 October 2005, entering the [[ARIA Charts|ARIA Album chart]] at No. 7. ''Australian Charts'' [http://australian-charts.com/showitem.asp?key=33095&cat=a The Secret Life Of... Charts] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090426140919/http://australian-charts.com/showitem.asp?key=33095&cat=a |date=26 April 2009 }} Accessed 5 October 2008 Since then, it has peaked at No. 2 and gone 4× Platinum. ''ARIA''[http://www.aria.com.au/pages/ARIACharts-Accreditations-2006Albums.htm The Secret Life Of... Accreditations] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110515024406/http://www.aria.com.au/pages/ARIACharts-Accreditations-2006Albums.htm |date=15 May 2011 }} Accessed 5 October 2008 Due to the success of the album, five singles were released in Australia: "[[4ever (The Veronicas song)|4ever]]", "[[Everything I'm Not]]", "[[When It All Falls Apart]]", "[[Revolution (The Veronicas song)|Revolution]]" and "[[Leave Me Alone (The Veronicas song)|Leave Me Alone]]". ''The Secret Life of The Veronicas'' spent a year on the ARIA album chart without leaving the Top 40. In September 2006, the album was nominated for three ARIA awards including; "Best Pop Release", "Highest Selling Album" and "Best Breakthrough Album". Access-All-Areas [http://www.accessallareas.net.au/music_news/EEVlEVpVFyCbQINvDD.php The Veronicas nominated 3 ARIAs and goes 4 times Platinum!] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081219035304/http://www.accessallareas.net.au/music_news/EEVlEVpVFyCbQINvDD.php |date=19 December 2008 }} . Retrieved 5 October 2008. They won "Best Pop Release" but lost the other two to other nominees.{{cite web|url=http://www.ariaawards.com.au/history-by-year.php?year=2006 |title=2006: 19th Annual ARIA Awards |publisher=Aria Awards.com |access-date=22 July 2008 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110519015949/http://www.ariaawards.com.au/history-by-year.php?year=2006 |archive-date=19 May 2011 }} The girls also performed their 2nd single "[[Everything I'm Not]]" on the night. The Daily Telegraph [http://www.news.com.au/dailytelegraph/story/0,22049,20655439-5006002,00.html ARIA or Angry: The Veronicas] {{Webarchive|url=https://archive.today/2012.09.04-010804/http://www.news.com.au/dailytelegraph/story/0,22049,20655439-5006002,00.html |date=4 September 2012 }} Accessed 5 October 2008 [[File:The Veronicas interviewed 2006.jpg|thumb|left|The Veronicas in October 2006]] The album was released in the US on 14 February 2006; it debuted at No. 133 on [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] and No. 3 on the ''Billboard'' Top Heatseekers chart.Billboard.com [{{BillboardURLbyName|artist=the veronicas|chart=all}} The Veronicas Chart History on Billboard.com]. Retrieved 5 October 2008. Only two singles were released in the United States off the album. A special DVD was released with the US version as a limited edition exclusive. The limited edition included two extra songs and videos, and was only available online. However, copies have been found to have been shipped to several stores in Australia as well. Other releases in the US include ''[[Sessions@AOL (The Veronicas EP)|Sessions@AOL]]'' which features their songs "Heavily Broken" and "Revolution" live in the AOL studios, Sessions@AOL EP. [http://new.music.yahoo.com/veronicas/albums/aol-sessions-live--29795010 AOL Sessions Live by The Veronicas] {{Webarchive|url=https://archive.today/2012.12.09-024812/http://new.music.yahoo.com/veronicas/albums/aol-sessions-live--29795010 |date=9 December 2012 }} ''[[Yahoo! Music]]''. Retrieved 3 November 2009. also released was ''[[The Veronicas: Mtv.com Live EP]]'' which also features live performances of their songs including a new song, titled "Stay". Mtv.com Live EP. [http://www.celebcards.com/albums/the_veronicas:_mtv.com_live_ep/ The Veronicas: Mtv.com Live EP] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110708130703/http://www.celebcards.com/albums/the_veronicas:_mtv.com_live_ep/ |date=8 July 2011 }} celebcards.com. Retrieved 3 November 2009. The album has also had success in other countries such as New Zealand where it debuted at No. 5, No. 75 on the Dutch Album Chart and No. 11 in Belgium. {{cite web |url=http://australian-charts.com/showitem.asp?key=33095&cat=a |title=The Veronicas – The Secret Life Of |publisher=Australian-charts.com |access-date=3 April 2015 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090426140919/http://australian-charts.com/showitem.asp?key=33095&cat=a |archive-date=26 April 2009 }} Due to their chart success in Belgium, they won the award for Best International New Artist at the TMF Awards of 2006. "When It All Falls Apart" spent a record of 17 weeks of MTV Asia's Pop 10 Chart, in which 7 of them were at the number 1 spot. The song was recorded in Simlish and is featured in the ''Sims 2'' expansion pack Seasons.{{cite web|url=http://www.gamezone.com/news/03_07_07_12_49PM.htm |title=Video Game News - EA Says That Hit Songs are Always in Season for the Sims |access-date=19 October 2008 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080930235946/http://www.gamezone.com/news/03_07_07_12_49PM.htm |archive-date=30 September 2008 }} Lisa and Jessica are the faces of Choice [[Calvin Klein]]{{cite web|title=Veronicas to hit the road. |url=http://www.undercover.com.au/news/2005/sep05/20050929_veronicas.html |access-date=30 September 2005 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20051105074048/http://undercover.com.au/news/2005/sep05/20050929_veronicas.html |archive-date=5 November 2005 |url-status=dead }} and Australian hair product company nu:u.{{Cite news|title=Move Over Kylie: here come The Veronicas.|url=http://www.theage.com.au/news/gig-previews--reviews/the-veronicas/2006/03/31/1143441327861.html|access-date=31 March 2006 | location=Melbourne | work=The Age | date=31 March 2006 | first=Craig | last=Mathieson}} [[Blender (magazine)|''Blender'']] magazine included them in their list of hottest women in rock in 2006.{{cite web|title=Hottest Women of...Rock! |url=http://www.blender.com/guide/articles.aspx?ID=2295&src=blender_ed |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070210001725/http://www.blender.com/guide/articles.aspx?id=2295 |archive-date=10 February 2007 }} The sisters sang the title song on the short-lived television show ''[[Related]]'' which had featured songs from their debut album. They appeared in an episode that aired 6 February 2006. {{cite news|url=https://movies.nytimes.com/person/1428935/The-Veronicas|title=The Veronicas|access-date=3 April 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121102155906/http://movies.nytimes.com/person/1428935/The-Veronicas|archive-date=2 November 2012|department=Movies & TV Dept.|work=[[The New York Times]]|date=2012|url-status=dead}} In March 2006, their debut single "4ever" was featured in the [[Amanda Bynes]] comedy ''[[She's the Man]]''. It was featured in the promotional television spots, the film itself and the soundtrack.{{cite web |url=https://www.amazon.com/dp/B000EBCEE0 |title=Nathan Wang: She's the Man: Music |website=Amazon |access-date=3 April 2015}} Their song "Revolution" appeared in another Amanda Bynes film, "[[Sydney White]]", in 2007. The girls also appeared on ''[[The Suite Life of Zack & Cody]]'' episode "The Suite Life Goes Hollywood" as guest stars and performed their song "Cry". {{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0946692/|title="The Suite Life of Zack and Cody" The Suite Life Goes Hollywood: Part 2 (TV Episode 2007)|website=[[IMDb]]|access-date=25 July 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170209195921/http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0946692/|archive-date=9 February 2017|url-status=live}} The twins have also created a fashion line called "The Veronicas for [[Target Australia|Target]]" which was released in stores on 25 August 2007 in Australia.{{Cite news|title=The Veronicas hit Target|url=http://www.news.com.au/heraldsun/story/0,21985,21897815-5012974,00.html|access-date=13 June 2007 | work=The Daily Telegraph | first1=Catherine | last1=Lambert | first2=Jen | last2=Melocco | date=13 June 2007}}{{cite web|url=http://www.target.com.au/theveronicas/ |title=The Veronicas |access-date=9 August 2007 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070830121802/http://www.target.com.au/theveronicas/ |archive-date=30 August 2007 }} On 2 December 2006, The Veronicas released a CD/DVD, titled ''[[Exposed... the Secret Life of The Veronicas]]'' in Australia which features live performances from their Australian 2006 [[List of The Veronicas concert tours|Revolution Tour]] and a DVD featuring parts of the sisters' live performances throughout 2005–2006, including footage that had previously not been seen, and their music videos.{{cite web|url=http://www.sanity.com.au/product/product.asp?sku%3D-945678%26affiliate%3D |access-date=8 February 2009 }}{{dead link|date=May 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}} The album debuted at No. 6 on the ARIA DVD Charts accrediting platinum in its first week. The second week it rose to its peak of No. 3[https://webarchive.nla.gov.au/awa/20061219130000/http://pandora.nla.gov.au/pan/23790/20061220-0000/Issue876.pdf ARIA Top 100 Chart Issue No. 876]{{cbignore|bot=medic}}. Pandora.nla.gov.au (23 August 2006). and was accredited Double Platinum.{{cite web|url=http://www.aria.com.au/pages/ARIACharts-Accreditations-2006DVD.htm |title=ARIA Charts – Accreditations – 2006 DVD |publisher=Aria.com.au |access-date=3 April 2015 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090705082550/http://www.aria.com.au/pages/ARIACharts-Accreditations-2006DVD.htm |archive-date=5 July 2009 }} ===2007–2009: ''Hook Me Up'' and worldwide expansion=== In early 2007, The Veronicas began work on their second album. The album was written and recorded in [[Los Angeles, California]], with [[Toby Gad]], [[Billy Steinberg]], [[Greg Wells]], [[Shelly Peiken]] and [[John Feldmann]]. [http://www.news.com.au/heraldsun/story/0,21985,22744853-5006024,00.html Sally Browne "The Veronicas take to the road with their new album"] {{Webarchive|url=https://archive.today/2012.09.06-105541/http://www.news.com.au/heraldsun/story/0,21985,22744853-5006024,00.html |date=6 September 2012 }}. ''[[Herald Sun]]''. Retrieved 13 November 2007. ''[[Hook Me Up]]'' was released in Australia on 3 November 2007. The album debuted at number two on the Australian ARIA Albums Chart with sales of 9,531 copies in its first week, and was certified Gold. [[Paul Cashmere|Cashmere, Paul]], (12 November 2007). [http://www.undercover.com.au/News-Story.aspx?id=3423 "Eagles Long Road Out of Eden Increases Sales in Australia"] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071113161907/http://undercover.com.au/News-Story.aspx?id=3423 |date=13 November 2007 }} . ''Undercover''. Undercover Media Pty Ltd. Retrieved 13 November 2007. It has since gone 2× platinum. [http://www.aria.com.au/pages/httpwww.aria.com.aupageshttpwww.aria.com.aupagesARIACharts-Accreditations-2008Albums.htm ARIA certifications – Albums 2008] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120112192933/http://www.aria.com.au/pages/httpwww.aria.com.aupageshttpwww.aria.com.aupagesARIACharts-Accreditations-2008Albums.htm |date=12 January 2012 }} . Aria.com.au (31 December 2008). The album became the twenty-eighth-highest selling album in Australia for 2007. [http://www.aria.com.au/pages/aria-charts-end-of-year-charts-top-100-albums-2007.htm "ARIA Charts – End Of Year Charts – Top 100 Albums 2007"] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120628093042/http://www.aria.com.au/pages/aria-charts-end-of-year-charts-top-100-albums-2007.htm |date=28 June 2012 }} . ''[[Australian Recording Industry Association]]''. Retrieved 29 June 2008. ''Hook Me Up'' was released in the UK on 12 October 2009 and has peaked at number thirty-five. [http://tommy2.net/content/?p=2352 The Veronicas Re-release Hook Me Up] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120304003151/http://tommy2.net/content/?p=2352 |date=4 March 2012 }}. Tommy2.net (8 May 2009). Hook Me Up UK charts. [https://www.officialcharts.com/archive/official-albums-chart/ Chart Stats – Veronicas – Hook Me Up] OfficialCharts.com. Retrieved 1 November 2009. The lead single from the album, "[[Hook Me Up (song)|Hook Me Up]]", was added to Australian radio on 27 August 2007, but was physically released on 22 September 2007. It debuted at number five, eventually reaching number one after seven weeks on the ARIA Singles Chart, making it their first number one hit in Australia. {{cite web |url=http://australian-charts.com/showitem.asp?interpret=The+Veronicas&titel=Hook+Me+Up&cat=s |title=The Veronicas – Hook Me Up |publisher=Australian-charts.com |access-date=3 April 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150509144134/http://australian-charts.com/showitem.asp?interpret=The+Veronicas&titel=Hook+Me+Up&cat=s |archive-date=9 May 2015 |url-status=live }} [[File:Veronicas Revenge Is Sweeter Tour Melbourne.jpg|thumb|upright=1.3|The Veronicas in concert during their [[Revenge Is Sweeter Tour (The Veronicas)|Revenge Is Sweeter tour]] in Melbourne|right]] "[[Untouched (song)|Untouched]]" was the first single to be released from their album in the United States, Canada, Europe and New Zealand. The song reached number 2 in Australia, {{cite web |url=http://australian-charts.com/showitem.asp?key=396032&cat=s |title=The Veronicas – Untouched |publisher=Australian-charts.com |access-date=3 April 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090224065501/http://australian-charts.com/showitem.asp?key=396032&cat=s |archive-date=24 February 2009 |url-status=live }} eventually reaching platinum accreditation. [http://www.aria.com.au/pages/httpwww.aria.com.aupageshttpwww.aria.com.aupagesARIACharts-Accreditations-2008Singles.htm ARIA Singles Certifications of 2008] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120207130302/http://www.aria.com.au/pages/httpwww.aria.com.aupageshttpwww.aria.com.aupagesARIACharts-Accreditations-2008Singles.htm |date=7 February 2012 }} {{Cite web |url=http://www.aria.com.au/pages/httpwww.aria.com.aupageshttpwww.aria.com.aupagesARIACharts-Accreditations-2008Singles.htm |title=Accreditations - ARIA |access-date=15 October 2008 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080927062539/http://www.aria.com.au/pages/httpwww.aria.com.aupageshttpwww.aria.com.aupagesARIACharts-Accreditations-2008Singles.htm |archive-date=27 September 2008 |url-status=bot: unknown }}. Aria.com.au (31 December 2008). The song became their first single to chart on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] debuting at number sixty-two{{cite magazine|url=http://www.billboard.com/charts/2008-12-13/hot-100 |title=Top 100 Songs | Billboard Hot 100 Chart |magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] |access-date=11 December 2008 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130324012303/http://www.billboard.com/charts/2008-12-13/hot-100 |archive-date=24 March 2013 }} and eventually peaking at number seventeen making it their first top twenty hit in the United States.[{{BillboardURLbyName|artist=the veronicas|chart=all}} The Veronicas Hot 100 peaks]. Billboard.com (8 December 2012). They became the first Australian artists to have a single certified Platinum in the U.S. with over 1,000,000 paid downloads.[{{BillboardURLbyName|artist=the veronicas|chart=Hot 100}} Billboard Hot 100 Singles Chart]. Billboard.com (8 December 2012). Cashmere, Paul. Acharts.us (1 April 2007). Their third and fourth singles, "[[This Love (The Veronicas song)|This Love]]" and "[[Take Me on the Floor]]", were both top ten hits in Australia {{cite web |url=http://australian-charts.com/showitem.asp?key=446295&cat=s |title=The Veronicas – This Love |publisher=Australian-charts.com |access-date=3 April 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090221102338/http://australian-charts.com/showitem.asp?key=446295&cat=s |archive-date=21 February 2009 |url-status=live }} and were both certified Gold. "Take Me on the Floor" was released as their second single in the U.S. but only peaked at number eighty-one.[{{BillboardURLbyName|artist=the veronicas|chart=all}} Artist Chart History – The Veronicas] On 11 October, their fifth single, "[[Popular (The Veronicas song)|Popular]]", was released digitally in Australia. It has only gained heavy airplay and peaked at No. 11 on the Australian Airplay Chart.{{cite web|url=http://www.aumreport.com/amr100.html |title=Australian Music Report Weekly Hot 100 |publisher=Aumreport.com |access-date=31 August 2010 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120210172332/http://www.aumreport.com/amr100.html |archive-date=10 February 2012 }} Their debut single "4ever" was re-released as their second single in the UK and Ireland on 21 September 2009 and has peaked at number 17 in the UK and twenty in Ireland. In February 2012, it was announced that a release date for the album was "coming soon". [http://lovetheveronicas.com/2012/02/third-album-soon/ "Third Album Release Dates Coming Soon!"] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120308165302/http://lovetheveronicas.com/2012/02/third-album-soon/ |date=8 March 2012 }} . LoveTheVeronicas.com (29 February 2012). ''LOM'' was tagged on their Twitter feeds as an important phrase on 15 May 2012. They also indicated the album was due for release in late 2012. On 2 June 2012, The Veronicas revealed the name of the album to be Life On Mars (Working title was; 'The Awakening' and they played with various titles like Death On Mars and Skeleton), and that it was to be released in September or October 2012. [http://video.perthnow.com.au/2241202907/The-Veronicas-Return "Video: The Veronicas Return"] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121107115448/http://video.perthnow.com.au/2241202907/The-Veronicas-Return |date=7 November 2012 }} . Video.perthnow.com.au (2 June 2012). Warner Music then delayed the release of the album until 2013, as stated by the Daily Telegraph on 2 September. Moran, Jonathon. (2 September 2012) [http://www.dailytelegraph.com.au/entertainment/veronicas-lisa-and-jess-rocket-to-new-heights/story-e6frewyr-1226462956757 "Veronicas Lisa and Jess rocket to new heights"] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140428210534/http://www.dailytelegraph.com.au/entertainment/veronicas-lisa-and-jess-rocket-to-new-heights/story-e6frewyr-1226462956757 |date=28 April 2014 }}. ''The Daily Telegraph'' (Australia). The first single off the then-promised album was titled "Lolita". The lyric video was released on 27 July 2012 and the official music video was released on 30 August.{{cite web|url=http://www.take40.com/news/32481/the-veronicas-are-coming-to-australia-this-month-with-new-song |title=Error - Take 40 |access-date=5 July 2012 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140407114210/http://www.take40.com/news/32481/the-veronicas-are-coming-to-australia-this-month-with-new-song |archive-date=7 April 2014 }} {{cite web |url=https://twitter.com/LoveTheVs/status/220813182187474944 |title=LoveTheVeronicas.com on Twitter: "The Veronicas new single 'Lolita' will be released on July 27 |publisher=Twitter.com |date=5 July 2012 |access-date=3 April 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160112024822/https://twitter.com/LoveTheVs/status/220813182187474944 |archive-date=12 January 2016 |url-status=live }} The Veronicas co-wrote and recorded backing vocals for a song called "Back to Life" which is included on EP 16 & Unstoppable by [[Christina Parie]] who finished 6th on third season [[The X Factor (Australian TV series)|The X Factor Australia]]. Due to label conflicts, The Veronicas embarked on a process of making many changes to the album. The release date was postponed, and the content and theme of the album was changed. The girls also explained that "Lolita" was not an official single promoting the new album "It was just a single release for our Australian fans, as it's been such a long time since we have had anything new over there". {{cite web |url=https://www.reddit.com/r/IAmA/comments/1be20a/we_are_jessica_lisa_marie_australian_twin_sister/ |title=We are Jessica & Lisa Marie, Australian twin sister ARIA-winning group The Veronicas, currently putting the finishing touches on our 3rd studio album in LA. Ask US Anything! |publisher=Reddit.com |date=31 March 2013 |access-date=16 June 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130612170034/http://www.reddit.com/r/IAmA/comments/1be20a/we_are_jessica_lisa_marie_australian_twin_sister/ |archive-date=12 June 2013 |url-status=live }} On 26 October 2013, The Veronicas announced via their official Facebook page that they had split from Warner Bros. Records. {{cite web |url=http://www.idolator.com/7492597/the-veronicas-record-label-drama/ |title=The Veronicas Split From Label, Prep Independent Release For February 2014 |publisher=Facebook.com |date=26 October 2013 |access-date=9 November 2013 |archive-url=https://archive.today/2013.11.09-171718/http://www.idolator.com/7492597/the-veronicas-record-label-drama |archive-date=9 November 2013 |url-status=live }} ===2014–2015: ''The Veronicas,'' record deal with Sony Music Entertainment=== [[File:The Veronicas 2014.jpg|thumb|The Veronicas performing live at [[The Forum (Inglewood, California)|The Forum]] in Inglewood, California in 2014]] In March 2014, The Veronicas started an internet series documenting the last few years of their journey titled "Did You Miss Me?". It was later announced that a record deal had been struck with [[Sony Music Entertainment]], and the long anticipated third album was to be released late in 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.2dayfm.com.au/shows/kyleandjackieo/video/the-veronicas-record-company-split// |title=The Veronica's Record Company Split |publisher=[[2Day FM]] |date=7 November 2013 |access-date=9 November 2013 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131109183439/http://www.2dayfm.com.au/shows/kyleandjackieo/video/the-veronicas-record-company-split// |archive-date=9 November 2013 }} The girls announced via Twitter on 5 September 2014 that their lead single for their third album was titled "[[You Ruin Me]]", and would be released 19 September 2014. Pre-order was made available as was a short teaser clip. The song premiered on Australian radio on 11 September 2014. On 27 September, the song debuted at number one on the ARIA Single Charts, The Veronicas' second number one single after "Hook Me Up" in 2007. ''Billboard'' announced that the third album was to be self-titled, ''[[The Veronicas (album)|The Veronicas]]'', {{cite magazine|title=The Veronicas Tease New Song 'You Ruin Me': Watch|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop-shop/6243720/the-veronicas-tease-new-song-you-ruin-me-watch|magazine=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|access-date=11 September 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140908004135/http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop-shop/6243720/the-veronicas-tease-new-song-you-ruin-me-watch|archive-date=8 September 2014|url-status=live}} and it was later confirmed by the ''Daily Telegraph'' that the album would be released in November.{{cite web|title=That's a wrap: The Veronicas finish filming new music video in Sydney|url=http://www.dailytelegraph.com.au/entertainment/sydney-confidential/thats-a-wrap-the-veronicas-finish-filming-new-music-video-in-sydney/story-fni0cvc9-1227060001691|website=The Daily Telegraph|access-date=16 September 2014|date=16 September 2014}} On 21 October, The Veronicas held a private showcase of their upcoming album for fans. The girls confirmed a number of tracks would be on the album, including "Cold", "Did You Miss Me?", "Mad Love" and "Sanctified". They also stated that future shows will be more intimate, "very theatrical" and interactive. {{cite web |url=https://www.buzzfeed.com/stephanieanderson/14-reasons-you-should-be-so-excited-for-the-veronicas-new-al |title=14 Reasons You Should Be SO EXCITED For The Veronicas' New Album |publisher=Buzzfeed.com |date=23 March 2015 |access-date=3 April 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150221113546/http://www.buzzfeed.com/stephanieanderson/14-reasons-you-should-be-so-excited-for-the-veronicas-new-al |archive-date=21 February 2015 |url-status=live }} On 24 October, pre-order of the album was made available on iTunes, with the track "Line of Fire" available as an instant download with the preorder. On 31 October, during a special album release secret show, song "[[If You Love Someone]]" was announced as a second single. The song was premiered on Australian radios on Wednesday 5 November, and was released alongside the launch of ''[[The Veronicas (album)|The Veronicas]]'' on 21 November.{{cite web|title=The Veronicas "If You Love Someone" (Single Premiere)|url=http://www.josepvinaixa.com/blog/the-veronicas-if-you-love-someone-premiere//|website=Ultimate Music|access-date=5 November 2014|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://archive.today/2014.11.05-163107/http://www.josepvinaixa.com/blog/the-veronicas-if-you-love-someone-premiere/|archive-date=5 November 2014}} The song became a success in their native Australia, charting at number 5 and was certified gold with sales upwards of 35,000. "Cruel" was released as the third single from the album. The Veronicas were the opening act for the Australian pop punk band, [[5 Seconds Of Summer]], on the pre-tour for the band's 2015 [[Rock Out With Your Socks Out Tour]] In January 2015, The Veronicas announced that their Sanctified Tour would extend to the UK in March, with five shows across the country.{{cite web | url=https://www.digitalspy.com/music/a622428/the-veronicas-to-bring-sanctified-tour-to-the-uk-in-march/ | title=The Veronicas to bring 'Sanctified' tour to the UK in March | work=[[Digital Spy]] | date= 19 January 2015 | access-date=4 June 2019 | author=Sam Rigby}} They also did a promo tour around both Europe and America. Their future plans involve a documentary, a new album, touring, writing a book and an EP. {{cite web |last=Papadatos |first=Markos |url=http://www.digitaljournal.com/a-and-e/music/the-veronicas-talk-webster-hall-michael-jackson-new-music/article/429603#ixzz3W7zQ91fi |title=The Veronicas talk Webster Hall, Michael Jackson, new music (Includes interview) |publisher=Digital Journal |date=30 March 2015 |access-date=3 April 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150405023215/http://www.digitaljournal.com/a-and-e/music/the-veronicas-talk-webster-hall-michael-jackson-new-music/article/429603#ixzz3W7zQ91fi |archive-date=5 April 2015 |url-status=live }} {{cite web |url=https://twitter.com/theveronicas/status/581465189012217857 |title=The Veronicas on Twitter: "NYC we're still high from lastnight. On our way to @Spotify to talk about the 7 new songs on our #RELOADED release |publisher=Twitter.com |date=27 March 2015 |access-date=3 April 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160112024822/https://twitter.com/theveronicas/status/581465189012217857 |archive-date=12 January 2016 |url-status=live }} Started fourth album effort on 28 July 2015. {{cite web |author=The Veronicas |url=https://twitter.com/TheVeronicas/status/625637969982943232 |title=The Veronicas on Twitter: "First day back in the studio, and we had @MarkRonson working next to us. Now thats some good vibes right there." |publisher=Twitter.com |access-date=25 July 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160305145926/https://twitter.com/TheVeronicas/status/625637969982943232 |archive-date=5 March 2016 |url-status=live }} ===2016–present: Single releases, television work, ''Godzilla'' and ''Human''=== [[File:The Veronicas live at Good Things Festival Melbourne 2019.jpg|thumb|upright=1.5|The Veronicas live at [[Good Things (Australian music festival)#2019|Good Things Festival Melbourne 2019]], before the ''Wall of death when The Veronica’s play Untouched at Good Things'' event]] On 19 June 2016, it was announced that The Veronicas will briefly replace [[The Madden Brothers]] as coaches on ''[[The Voice (Australian TV series)|The Voice Australia]]''. The duo will be coaching their team of contestants for 1 week and appearing for the first live show airing on 26 June 2016. During an interview with [[News Corp Australia|NewsLimited]], the duo stated "Any opportunity where we get to interact with and supporting other artists in any way is exciting for us". This was related to their single "[[In My Blood (The Veronicas song)|In My Blood]]". {{cite web |author=Idolator.com |url=http://www.idolator.com/7638141/the-veronicas-in-my-blood-video |title=The Veronicas Debut "In My Blood" Video On 'The Voice Australia': Watch idolator |publisher=Idolator.com |date=26 June 2016 |access-date=25 July 2017 }}{{cite web |author=Joey Nolfi |url=http://www.ew.com/article/2016/06/26/veronicas-in-my-blood-music-video |title=In My Blood music video: The Veronicas are seeing red in clip for new single |publisher=Ew.com |date=26 June 2016 |access-date=25 July 2017 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160629052816/http://www.ew.com/article/2016/06/26/veronicas-in-my-blood-music-video |archive-date=29 June 2016 |url-status=live }} Their single's music video "[[On Your Side (The Veronicas song)|On Your Side]]" premiered on 17 November 2016, the video is written, directed and starred by actress and model [[Ruby Rose]].{{cite web | url=http://www.dailytelegraph.com.au/entertainment/sydney-confidential/the-veronicas-jess-features-in-sexy-new-music-video-with-girlfriend-ruby-rose/news-story/fe22bca2fa1efac23839d22f8221da8b | title=The Veronicas' Jess features in sexy new music video with girlfriend Ruby Rose | access-date=25 July 2017}} The pair hosted the [[ARIA Music Awards of 2016]], providing a [[Toplessness|topless]] performance of "[[In My Blood (The Veronicas song)|In My Blood]]".{{cite news|date=November 2016|title=Australian duo The Veronicas perform topless live at the Arias|url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/entertainment/music/86818642/australian-duo-the-veronicas-perform-topless-live-at-the-arias|publisher=[[Stuff.co.nz]]|access-date=24 November 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180816093655/https://www.stuff.co.nz/entertainment/music/86818642/australian-duo-the-veronicas-perform-topless-live-at-the-arias|archive-date=16 August 2018|url-status=live}} Social media users gave mixed responses during the night but there was praise for The Veronicas going topless on national television. The Veronicas performed at the [[Sydney Gay and Lesbian Mardi Gras]] after party on 4 March.{{cite news|url=http://www.news.com.au/national/breaking-news/the-veronicas-to-perform-at-mardi-gras/news-story/714b9942c277ea85e25732b0fcc859c1|title=The Veronicas to perform at Mardi Gras|date=23 January 2017|access-date=24 January 2017|first=Danielle|last=McGrane|publisher=[[News.com.au]] ([[News Limited]])}} On 31 May 2017, the Veronicas announced the release of the third single, "[[The Only High]]", from their upcoming album which was originally scheduled to be released in June 2017,{{cite web|author=31 May, 20178:48am |url=http://www.news.com.au/entertainment/music/the-veronicas-tease-epic-piano-ballad-the-only-high-ahead-of-new-release/news-story/c0a1654f3a47c293b22012b9836033a5 |title=The Veronicas release new single The Only High on Friday, twitter tease |publisher=News.com.au |date=31 May 2017 |access-date=25 July 2017}} but was announced on 13 November 2017 that they would not release any new material until 2018.{{Cite web|url=https://twitter.com/theveronicas/status/929848160100302849|title=To all of our amazing supporters, we announced earlier this year we would release our 4th studio album in 2017, but due to personal circumstances out of our control, we have made the decision to hold releases till 2018. Thank you for your ongoing love. See you next year XX|last=Veronicas|first=The|date=12 November 2017|website=@theveronicas|language=en|access-date=12 November 2017}} On 15 April 2018, The Veronica's performed "[[Can't Get You Out of My Head]]" at the [[2018 Commonwealth Games closing ceremony]]. They released another new single, "[[Think of Me (The Veronicas song)|Think of Me]]", in March 2019.{{cite web |last1=Wass |first1=Mike |title=The Veronicas Return With Raw Breakup Anthem, "Think Of Me" |url=https://www.idolator.com/7734731/veronicas-new-single-think-of-me-review |website=idolator |access-date=9 May 2019 |date=29 March 2019}} The pair planned to release their next single, "Life of the Party" featuring Australian rapper [[Allday]], in July 2019,{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jBVdN2q5BmM| archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211117/jBVdN2q5BmM| archive-date=2021-11-17 | url-status=live|title=The Veronicas Discuss Their Single, "Think of Me" & More|publisher=Build Series|via=YouTube|date=27 June 2019|access-date=29 June 2019|format=relevant discussion starts at 16:33}}{{cbignore}} although this did not occur. In October 2019, it was confirmed the duo's reality show is titled ''[[The Veronicas: Blood Is for Life]]'', and will premiere on MTV on 10 November 2019.{{cite web|url=https://junkee.com/the-veronicas-reality-show/224374|title=The Trailer For The Veronicas' New Reality Show Is Heavy On The Drama|website=[[Junkee]]|last=Earp|first=Joseph|date=9 October 2019|access-date=9 October 2019}} To go along with the reality show the duo released ‘Ugly’ the song which also serves as the theme song as well as where the title comes from.{{cite web | url=https://retropopmagazine.com/delta-goodrem-announces-one-off-intimate-uk-gig-at-londons-lafayette/ | title=Delta Goodrem announces one-off intimate UK gig at London's Lafayette | date=27 September 2022 }}{{cite web | url=https://www.nme.com/en_au/news/music/the-veronicas-announce-new-album-human-2697336 | title=The Veronicas release new single 'Biting My Tongue' | website=[[NME]] | date=2 July 2020 }} The Veronicas appeared at Good Things Festival 2019. At their Melbourne date, the duo was preceded by a [[Facebook]] event titled 'Wall of death when The Veronica's play Untouched at Good Things'.{{cite web |last1=Thomas |first1=Justin |last2=Tadd |first2=Reilly |title=Wall of death when The Veronica's play Untouched at Good Things place due to the [[COVID-19 pandemic]].{{cite web|url= https://www.smh.com.au/culture/tv-and-radio/boy-george-kelly-rowland-filming-the-voice-remotely-due-to-covid-19-20200605-p54zx1.html|title=Boy web|url=https://www.heraldsun.com.au/lifestyle/stellar/noone-will-be-expecting-this-veronica-reveals-next-move/news-story/b6607cf4082a5fc2b51eb57e650a90b3|title='No-one will be expecting this': url=https://themusicnetwork.com/artists-split-from-sony-music-pat-handlin/ | title=Multiple Artists Split from Sony Music, Pat Handlin Plots Next Move with Kyle Sandilands? (EXCLUSIVE) | date=23 May 2022 }} They left Sony Music in 2022 In September 2022 they released separate solo projects, Jessica's called "Seeing Stars" and Lisa's called "Cruisin' On My Own".{{cite web | url=https://tonedeaf.thebrag.com/we-finally-know-the-truth-about-the-veronicas-solo-careers/ | title=We finally know the truth about the Veronicas' solo careers | date=7 September 2022 }}{{cite web | url=https://celebrity.nine.com.au/latest/the-veronicas-announce-solo-careers-tease-new-singles/dbc1e2e5-e3e0-402e-aa09-cdc97df5fa9c | title=The Veronicas announce solo careers and tease their new singles }} ==Philanthropy== [[File:The Veronicas 2005.jpg|thumb|right|upright|The Veronicas in November 2005]] In 2006, the Veronicas joined [[Steve Irwin]]'s [[Wildlife Warriors Worldwide]], a charity that deals with the protection of animals and their natural environments. [http://www.wildlifewarriors.org.au/in_the_media/wwwveronicas.html Wildlife Warriors – The Veronicas Are saving the animals, with a little help from Steve Irwin] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100415215228/http://www.wildlifewarriors.org.au/in_the_media/wwwveronicas.html |date=15 April 2010 }} . Wildlifewarriors.org.au. The band was also featured in an Australian public service announcement campaign against [[Copyright infringement|music piracy]] targeting schools, labeled ''Australian Music In Tune''. Other successful Australian artists included were [[Powderfinger]], [[Jimmy Barnes]] and [[Silverchair]].{{Cite news| url=http://www.theage.com.au/news/music/labelled-with-love/2008/06/19/1213770781342.html | location=Melbourne | work=The Age | title=Labelled with love | date=20 June 2008}} Work for this charity has included a texting competition to reach two-thousand text messages in the hopes of raising one thousand dollars.{{cite web|url=http://www.theveronicas.com/text-challenge |title=THE VERONICAS TEXT CHALLENGE | the Veronicas |access-date=31 January 2009 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090203104458/http://www.theveronicas.com/text-challenge |archive-date=3 February 2009 }} In January 2009, it was announced Jess would pose nude for [[People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals|PETA]] after getting attention from a member of the organization. [https://www.news.com.au/entertainment/music/veronicas-twin-jess-to-bare-all-again/news-story/33558f8184bb3284a41b55e2ad52133d Veronicas twin Jess Origliasso to bare all for PETA shoot]. News.com.au (18 March 2009). Lisa also marched alongside [[Drew Barrymore]], [[Pete Wentz]], [[Janice Dickinson]], and other celebrities in support of gay marriage in California at a May 2009 March in Los Angeles protesting 26 May 2009 decision of the [[Supreme Court of California|California Supreme Court]] ruling upholding [[California Proposition 8|Proposition 8]]. {{cite web |author=Jody Thompson |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/celebs/news/2009/05/27/kelly-osbourne-joins-rally-to-protest-at-california-gay-marriage-ban-as-other-celebs-speak-of-their-outrage-115875-21393671/ |title=Kelly Osbourne, Drew Barrymore and more celebs join rally to protest at California gay marriage ban – see pics |work=Daily Mirror |access-date=31 August 2010 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100926205212/http://www.mirror.co.uk/celebs/news/2009/05/27/kelly-osbourne-joins-rally-to-protest-at-california-gay-marriage-ban-as-other-celebs-speak-of-their-outrage-115875-21393671/ |archive-date=26 September 2010 |url-status=live |date=27 May 2009 }} They also joined a "Wear it with Pride" campaign to reform [[Homosexuality|same-sex]] laws in Australia for the 85 legislative changes made in 2010 to overturn discrimination against same-sex couples and their families. The campaign involved them wearing numbered T-shirts representing each legislative change.Jonathon Moran. [http://www.dailytelegraph.com.au/news/sunday-telegraph/natalie-bassingthwaighte-sings-for-gay-marriage-equality/story-e6frewt0-1225822859978 NatBass sings for gay marriage] ''[[The Daily Telegraph (Sydney)|Daily Telegraph]]''. Retrieved 2 February 2010. In 2010 Lisa and Jessica were honoured as Wildlife Warriors of the year for their efforts in publicizing animal protection and conservation on a worldwide scale.{{Cite news|url=http://www.sunshinecoastdaily.com.au/story/2010/04/01/terri-irwin-veronicas-australia-zoo/ |title=Australia Zoo celebrates its 40th |last=Furler|first=Mark|date=1 April 2010|access-date=3 June 2010|work=[[Sunshine Coast Daily]]|publisher=[[APN News & Media]]}} The Veronicas also advocate for [[Sea Shepherd Conservation Society|Sea Shepherd]].{{cite web|url=http://www.seafm.com.au/goldcoast/scoopla/music/blog/2014/12/watch-the-veronicas-inspiring-new-clip-/ |title=WATCH: The Veronicas Inspiring New Clip! |publisher=Seafm.com.au |date=20 December 2014 |access-date=6 May 2015}} They also spoke up against the forced closures of Aboriginal Communities in Australia. {{cite web |last=Nagorski |first=Alex |url=http://popbytes.com/exclusive_interview_with_the_veronicas/ |title=INTERVIEW: The Rebirth of The Veronicas |publisher=PopBytes.com |date= 28 March 2015|access-date=6 May 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150508023755/http://popbytes.com/exclusive_interview_with_the_veronicas/ |archive-date=8 May 2015 |url-status=live }} ==Products and endorsements== The Veronicas range of endorsements have included Australian hair products Nu:U Nu:U endorsement.
